content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a Julia function that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences, and joins them together with newlines:
```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    
    # Initialize a list to store the extracted code blocks
    code_blocks = []
    
    # Iterate through each line
    is_in_code_block = false
    for i in 1:length(lines)
        line = lines[i]
        
        # Check if the line starts with a triple backtick (beginning of a code fence)
        if startswith(line, '```') && !is_in_code_block
            is_in_code_block = true
        end
        
        # Check if the line ends with a triple backtick (end of a code fence)
        if endswith(line, '```') && is_in_code_block
            push!(code_blocks, lines[i-2:i])  # Remove the double backticks at the beginning and end of the code block
            is_in_code_block = false
        end
    end
    
    # Join the extracted code blocks together with newlines
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function takes a markdown document as input (`md::String`) and returns a string containing the Julia code blocks joined with newlines.
